posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Different shades of sorcerer builds seem to pop up this week, so I felt inspired to look at some of my own sorcerer builds when I found this one.
I share it here for feedback before I go ahead and play it for further testing.
The idea is a mage that pops in and out of stealth, showing up anywhere and unloads her spells before vanishing again.
The Invisibility spell could have done the trick, but spamming stealth (HIPS) with a caster has a different flavour to it.

I use Palemaster as stepping stone for the stealth skills. I could have gone with rogue (and UMD) or any other stealth class, but went with PM for the spell slots (at least pre epic) and the slightly better AC. I think it is a cool and different way to use the class for its class skills. PM also fits thematically this shadow caster with her focus on necro spells.
SD takes stealth further and offers HIPS, tumble, evasion and UD. With the epic skill feats, stealth becomes comparable to that of a dexer.
The sorcerer part still has 36 class levels, a charisma of 34 and the most essential feats.
Any input and feedback is welcome.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi Mick. You more than anyone know I am far from qualified to comment on a caster build, but I'm just wondering...

If the intention is to swoop in from invisibility (via HiPS), cause mayhem and death, then zip back out again, are EMA and Epic Warding a "safe", belt and braces approach? Why not give her Hellball and Greater Ruin just for the sheer devilment of it?

You probably have better reasons for taking what you do, but I thought I'd ask...

Cheers

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Mick
This build looks pretty well optimised to me
I would only make minor tweaks if I were to play it.
One would be to move the spell focus / greater spell focus: necromancy feats to a bit later pre-epic, maybe when you get access to finger of death.
You could also choose Gnome, or Halfling as races, you won't have multiclass penalties with your class combo. Smaller classes have better stealth capabilities. There may be RP reasons not to do this. Would I do this? I would be tempted to stick with human to be honest. The skill points are handy in Sorc/SD builds.

This is a matter of personal preference but I would fit toughness into the build by aiming for a ending Charisma score of 32 and base HP close to 300 to mitigate the Sorc d4 hit die issue. The remaining epic feat that is freed up can deal with another vulnerability, could be saves (Epic Fortitude), rest restrictions (Craft Wand/Scribe Scroll), interrupted spells (ESF: Concentration/Epic Energy Resistance, Craft Wand). But some players don't mind playing with less HP and that is fine too

Edit
One additional thought. ranger 1 epic levels allows you to take ESF: Necromancy as a bonus feat and grants stealth skill dumping to qualify for SD? If you are willing to wait till epics for SD. You could take ranger pre epic but then you don't get that nice benefit I think. Although GSF can be taken as a bonus feat pre epic? Might be worth looking into!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Thank you both!
@Stag I am not a very big fan of the epic damage spells, but replacing EMA and EW with something may be an option. They come in handy though against true seers where stealth won't work.

@Orion Allocating pre epic feats may possibly improve playability, so I will look into it. I have tried to make it a gnome, but it fell a bit short on skill points. As for Toughness I cringe at the thought of swapping an epic feat for it. (Edit: I don't see d4 as an issue.) Taking a single level of ranger for the great/epic spell focus feat grants synerergy as it also gives the stealth skills. I may look into that as well.

My priority if I could free up epic feats would be a second school focus or simply more charisma.
